posts.title: Enjoying a Picnic with a refreshing and easy to make Mango-Pineapple Summer Drink
posts.description: To celebrate Midsummer today we created a wonderful refreshing and tasty summer cocktail for you!
posts.content: What could be better than a delicious and fresh summer drink during these lovely and warm summer days?! When we found this gorgeous wild flower fields in the woods last week, we knew it would be the perfect spot for a cozy summer picnic. So we took our bikes for a quick bike tour and enjoyed some wonderful hours here. We teamed up with Belvedere Vodka again and used their pretty summer bottle edition for this Mango-Pineapple Summer Vodka drink. Itâ€™s super easy to make and basically tastes like summer in a glass! We used pineapple juice, mango juice, orange juice, passionfruit juice, a little bit of lemon, ginger syrup, Belvedere Vodka and a shot of whipping cream for the summer cocktail â€“ super delicious! We also took some gluten-free bread, a little bit of cheese and some fruits to our picnic â€“ a wonderful addition to the fruity drink. We hope you enjoy the recipe and happy Midsummer guys! Please drink responsibly.

recipe.instructions: Pour pineapple juice, mango juice, orange juice, lemon juice, ginger syrup and Belvedere Vodka into a shaker. Halve the passion fruit and strain the juice through a fine metal sieve into the shaker. Add ice cubes and shake well, then pour into a well-chilled cocktail glass and add a dash of whipping cream. Optionally, you can also add the whipping cream to the shaker. Serve the Mango-Pineapple Summer Vodka with fresh mint, a lemon wedge and a glass straw.

posts.title: Gluten-free Waffles with Chai Ice-Cream and Cherry Compote
posts.description: We are excited to share a new recipe with you guys today - perfect for a little treat during the Christmas holidays.
posts.content: One of our absolutely favorite things during winter is chai tea. It makes the cold winter months so much more cozy and always reminds us of lovely walks through the city while admiring all the beautiful christmas lights in town in December. Another favorite of ours are gluten-free waffles â€“ we already have many gluten-free waffle recipes on the blog, because what could be more comforting than a warm waffle for breakfast, right? To combine those two favorites of ours we decided to make gluten-free waffles with a cherry compote and chai ice-cream. Such a delicious combination! We prepared the batter for the gluten-free waffles with the Kenwood Cooking Chef XL kitchen machine and also the cherry compote. What we love about the Cooking Chef XL is that it has an integrated scale, which makes it very easy to prepare batter and many other dishes. The cherry compote we cooked with the induction function of the Cooking Chef XL kitchen machine, which worked out so well. Itâ€™s super nice, that you can prepare so many different recipes with only one machine, we love it! We hope you enjoy our Christmas recipe during the holidays, we will make it again for sure.

ingredients: 250g gluten-free flour mixture (or rice flour or buckwheat flour)
about 300ml milk or plant milk (we used soy milk)
coconut oil or butter for greasing the waffle iron
recipe.instructions: For the waffles, separate the eggs and beat the egg whites for 30-60 seconds until stiff. Melt the butter, let it cool down briefly, then add the milk. Mix gluten-free flour, baking powder and salt. Beat the egg yolks with the sugar for 30 seconds, then fold in the butter-milk mixture. Mix in the flour mixture in 2 portions with a whisk â€“ the dough should not be too runny or too firm. Finally, fold in the egg whites in 2-3 portions with a silicone spatula. Preheat and grease the waffle iron, then fry the waffle batter in portions.

posts.title: Gluten-free Vegan Pizza with Sweet-Potato-Dough
posts.description: When we visited our dear friend Frida in her charming old schoolhouse in Sweden last month, Nora made our favorite gluten-free vegan pizza one evening. We are so excited to share the recipe with you guys today!
posts.content: Since last winter we want to share the recipe for our favorite gluten-free vegan pizza with you and somehow it never made it to the blog. Now itâ€™s really about time and we are excited to hear your feedback. In winter we made the dough with pumpkin, but since there was no pumpkin available in June we used sweet potato instead, which worked out so well! For the topping we used our favorite vegan spinach pesto, that we already shared with you in this post and all our favorite vegetables, like mushrooms, tomatoes, carrots, fennel and onions. We usually also put olives and artichoke hearts on top, but somehow couldnâ€™t find them in the swedish countryside. Anyways this gluten-free vegan pizza is a true treat and you seriously donâ€™t need cheese on top, even if youâ€™re not vegan. We all loved it and it was such a pleasure to enjoy it in the dreamy garden of our dear friend Frida.

ingredients: 250g gluten-free flour mix for yeast dough
recipe.instructions: Peel the sweet potato, cut into slices and bake in the oven on a sheet of baking paper at 200Â°C (400Â°F) top/bottom heat until soft. Then take 150g of the baked sweet potato and purÃ©e together with the coconut milk. Blend gluten-free flour mix, active dry yeast, salt and spices in a mixing bowl. Add the sweet potato purÃ©e and olive oil (the purÃ©e should be warm, but not hot) and knead the dough for 2 minutes (use disposable gloves, if possible) â€“ donÂ´t knead too long, the dough should be still relatively sticky. Take a new mixing bowl (plastik, no metal!), brush the inside with a vegetable oil and leave the gluten-free yeast dough in the bowl for 1,5 hours on a warm spot to let the dough raise, covered with a damp kitchen towel. In the meantime prepare the vegan spinach pesto. Mix all ingredients in a blender. When the dough is raised, overturn it carefully on a big floured piece of baking paper, flour the top and the rolling pin as well and roll out the dough to a large circle (if you want to work accurate, you can draw a large circle with a pencil on the baking paper as orientation before and cut away the overlapping edges with a pizza cutter afterwards). Pull the gluten-free pizza dough together with the baking paper on a baking sheet and let raise for another 30-40 minutes, before you spread the vegan spinach pesto on top. Meanwhile preheat the oven to 250Â°C (500Â°F) top/bottom heat and cut the vegetables: cut the carrots into sticks, the mushrooms into slices, the red onions in quarters, the fennel into slices and the tomatoes into halves. After you spread the pesto, start topping with carrots, followed by the fennel, mushrooms, tomatoes and onions. Brush the mushrooms and onions with some vegetable oil. Then bake the gluten-free vegan pizza for about 30 minutes until crispy, then top with pumpkin seeds, seasalt, pepper and fresh thyme. Serve together with a few lemon quarters.

posts.title: Goat Milk Rice with homemade Peach Compote
posts.description: We are ecxited to share a new and simple recipe with you guys today, perfect for a lovely summer morning!
posts.content: The last hot weeks of summer are here and we so enjoy it! We are currently in Sweden (more about that in our next post) and the weather here is simply wonderful right now. If youâ€™re longing for a cold and fruity breakfast, this lovely goat milk rice with homemade compote is simply divine! Itâ€™s not long anymore that we can have these delicious summer fruits this year, so making compotes is definitely a good way to enjoy them a few weeks longer. Of course you can also serve this breakfast warm during autumn and winter, maybe with a nice apple compote instead. When we photographed the goat milk rice it was actually quite a moody day and the garden was the perfect scenery for this little cozy set up. With our dear friends and neighbors Rahel, Lea and Anita and we enjoyed the goat milk rice with homemade compote and we all loved it. We hope you guys will enjoy it too! We are currently really into videos and hope to have some time to do more recipe videos for you soon â€“ what do you guys think?

ingredients: 1000ml goat milk (or another one, if you donÂ´t like the taste)
recipe.instructions: Bring the goat milk to boil with a little pinch of salt, add the pudding rice and cook on low heat for about 25-30 minutes (as recommended on the packing instructions) â€“ stir occasionally. Meanwhile pit the peaches and apricots, slices them in thin wedges and place them together with the sugar in a pot, add little water (max. 200ml), so the fruit is slightly covered and add the tea strainer with the lavender. Add the lemon juice and ground vanilla, bring everything to boil and let simmer for 10-15 minutes. Afterwards remove the tea strainer and thicken the peach-apricote-compote with the cornstarch (mix 3-4 tbsp liquid with the cornstach and stir this into the compote) or fill the soft fruits into a jar and the liquid into a carafe, which you can serve to the rice pudding. If you serve the rice pudding in a glass, start with a layer of rice pudding, then a layer of compote and a few redcurrants, followed by a second layer of rice pudding and compote and a few coconut flakes and redcurrants for topping.

posts.title: Gluten-free Cheesecake with Meringue
posts.description: We have another easy and delicious baking recipe for you guys today - our favorite gluten-free cheesecake with meringue.
posts.content: In these very strange and challenging times it feels so good to calm the mind while baking a simple cake in the kitchen. So todayâ€™s recipe is very easy to make and of course very delicious. What could be more comforting than a nice cheesecake ðŸ™‚ Our recipe is inspired by Noraâ€™s favorite childhood cheesecake that her mother used to bake for her. Of course we turned it into a gluten-free version. The cake has a wonderful and fluffy meringue topping, so good! We hope you guys enjoy our gluten-free cheesecake with meringue recipe!

ingredients: 250g gluten-free flour mix or rice flour
recipe.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180Â°C/360Â°F top and bottom heat. Line the bottom of the springform pan with baking paper, butter and flour the sides. Mix gluten-free flour with baking powder, sugar and salt, then add the soft butter in small pieces and knead everything, add the egg and continue kneading. If the pastry is too crumbly or dry, add 1-2 tablespoons of cold water. Spread the pastry thinly on the bottom and edge of the springform pan and press it on with your fingers. For the filling, mix all the ingredients except the cornstarch in a mixing bowl with the electric whisk, then beat in the cornstarch. Pour the filling into the springform pan and bake the gluten-free cheesecake for 50 minutes, beat the egg whites with the salt semi-stiff just before the end of the baking time, then gradually add the sugar and beat until stiff for 1-2 minutes. Take the cheesecake out of the oven, turn the oven temperature down to 160Â°C/360Â°F. Spread the meringue evenly on the cheesecake, leaving 1cm free from the edge as the meringue will expand while baking. Bake the gluten-free cheesecake with meringue for another 15-20 minutes until the meringue turns golden brown. Let the gluten-free cheesecake with meringue cool down for at least 1 hour before serving.

posts.title: Gluten-free Chocolate-Cherry Cake with Berries
posts.description: Before we completely dive into all the wonderful autumn recipes, we want to share this late summer Chocolate Cherry Cake recipe with you guys!
posts.content: This lovely gluten-free summer chocolate cherry cake with berries is so easy to make and so delicious! Chocolate, cherries, berries and cream are always a winning combination, you canâ€™t go wrong with that! A few weeks ago we discovered this dreamy grass field on a bike tour and just knew we had to come back for a little picnic. The light was simply wonderful, definitely one of those summer evenings you wonâ€™t forget. The gluten-free chocolate cherry cake might be not the most practical picnic food to bring along, but it was definitely worth it! As cherries are out of season now, we would recommend to use blackberries and pears instead â€“ so delicious! We hope you enjoy these late summer days, before autumn sets in.

recipe.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180Â°C/360Â°F top and bottom heat. Line the bottom of the springform pan with baking paper, butter and flour the sides. Melt the butter. Separate the eggs and beat the egg whites for 1 minute until semi stiff, then add the sugar and continue beating for 1 minute until the egg whites are firmer. Mix the egg yolks with the maple syrup and salt in a separate bowl, then stir in the lukewarm melted butter. Mix the gluten-free flour with the baking cocoa and the baking powder and fold alternately with the egg white under the egg yolk-butter-mixture (sieve in the flour and ideally use a silicone spatula). Pour the gluten-free batter into the springform pan and bake for about 45 minutes â€“ do a toothstick test. Let the chocolate cake cool for about 1 hour, then cut into 3 layers with a long bread knife. For the filling, whip the heavy cream with the sugar, vanilla and cream stabilizer. Spread 100g cherry jam on each of the two lower cake bases, then spread a thick layer of whipped cream. Spread another layer of whipped cream on top of the cake and decorate with cherries and berries.

posts.title: Easy and Delicious Gluten-free Lemon Cake with Rosemary
posts.description: Today we want to share a new gluten-free cake recipe with you guys, a gluten-free lemon cake with rosemary.
posts.content: After the last grey and rainy weeks we needed some color on our plates, so Nora came up with this simple and delicious gluten-free lemon cake recipe. Not only the color is wonderful to look at, the whole cake has a perfect consistency and the slightly herb aroma of the rosemary fits so well with the sweet-sour taste from the lemon cake.  After some busy weeks in our Berlin studio we finally took the time to go to our beloved countryside place and it was so lovely to enjoy some slow countryside mornings here. Weâ€™ve enjoyed the gluten-free lemon cake together with our dear neighbors and friends Rahel, Lea and Anita and everyone loved it! We hope you guys like the new recipe too!

recipe.rtitle: Easy Gluten-Free Lemon Cake with Rosemary
recipe.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 180Â°C/360Â°F top and bottom heat. Grease and flour a loaf pan.
Mix gluten-free flour mixture, baking powder and turmeric. Beat soft butter for 1 minute with a hand mixer or kitchen machine, then gradually add sugar and finally ground vanilla and beat butter for at least 5 minutes until lightly and more fluffy. Beat in one egg at a time for about 30 seconds. Mix in 4 tbsp lemon juice and 1 tbsp zest. Add the flour and baking powder mix in 2 portions and stir in with a silicone spatula, stir in the vegetable milk in between. Fill the gluten-free batter into the loaf pan and bake the gluten-free lemon cake for 50-60 minutes â€“ make the wooden skewer test to see if the batter is done. Let the gluten-free lemon cake cool for 15 minutes before removing the loaf pan. Sift the icing sugar (if lumpy) then mix the icing sugar with 2-3 tbsp lemon juice and spread the icing on the cake. Top the gluten-free lemon cake with lemon slices of 1/2 organic lemon and refine with coconut flakes and lemon zest. Finely chop the rosemary and sprinkle over the lemon cake.

posts.title: Gluten-free Spring Pasta with Pomi Tomato Sauce & Vegetables
posts.description: Today we have a delicious spring pasta for you guys!
posts.content: The weather is finally getting better and spring is in the air! The apple trees in the garden are in full bloom and we bought delicious green asparagus in the organic supermarket. We teamed up with Pomi for this post and used their organic strained tomatoes for this tasty spring pasta recipe. We always love to eat gluten-free pasta a few times a week and this spring pasta recipe is a new favorite for sure! Thanks to the strained tomatoes from Pomi, itâ€™s quite a light meal and all the vegetables like peas, green asparagus and fava beans give you all the extra spring feelings. We also added buffalo mozarella, which is the perfect addition when you like to eat cheese. We grilled it in the oven, so it got nicely melted on top, so fabulous! We hope you will enjoy this colorful spring recipe as well!

recipe.rtitle: Gluten-Free Pasta with Tomato Sauce, Green Asparagus and Mozarella
recipe.instructions: Peel the fava beans and blanch in boiling water, then refresh, shell the skin and cook the fava beans again for about 10 minutes in salted water. Cook the peas and penne pasta as well in salted water until firm bite. Cut off the stringy ends of the green asparagus, then cut in smaller bites and fry in olive oil for 5 minutes. Chop the onion, fry in olive oil for a moment, then stir in the pressed garlic and tomato sauce. Afterwards season with cayenne pepper, cumin, honey, salt and pepper. Switch on the grill function of your oven. Fill about one third of the tomato sauce on the bottom of the baking dish, then spread one layer of penne pasta, fava beans, peas and green asparagus. Continue with a second layer of penne pasta, fava beans, peas and asparagus, then spread the remaining tomato sauce on the penne pasta and top with mozarella pieces. Cut the cherry tomatoes in halves and arrange on top. Grill the penne pasta dish for around 12 minutes or until the mozarella has melted. In the end decorate with fresh basil.
